intro: Arctotis calendulacea var. tristis, commonly known as the blue everlasting, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to violet petals and yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, daisy-like flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its long-lasting blooms and drought tolerance make it a valuable addition to native plant collections.
